title: Can i sue a corp. and a lease guarantor who filed for bankruptcy for not paying me rent or damages?
question: I own a commercial building, it was a body shop business. The owner of the business is in prison and that leaves the guarantor. The corp. and guarantor filed for bankruptcy.
answers: Corp. and Guarantor have sought the protection of the bankruptcy court. The Automatic Stay provisions of Title 11 USC ยง362(a) prohibit the commencement or continuation of any act to collect a debt, without first obtaining permission from the bankruptcy court. You may be out of luck. Consult with an attorney who handles "Creditor rights" to see if you have a cause of action against the petitioners.
